001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq;
002
003/**
004 * Use record-style naming, rather than JavaBean naming, just for fun. (Maybe this will migrate to a record
005 * some day.)
006 *
007 * @param <T>
008 */
009public class BitcoinZmqMessage<T> {
010    private final Topic topic;
011    private final T value;
012    private final long sequenceNumber;
013
014    public BitcoinZmqMessage(Topic topic, T value, long sequenceNumber) {
015        this.topic = topic;
016        this.value = value;
017        this.sequenceNumber = sequenceNumber;
018    }
019
020    public Topic topic() {
021        return topic;
022    }
023
024    public T value() {
025        return value;
026    }
027
028    public long sequenceNumber() {
029        return sequenceNumber;
030    }
031
032    /**
033     * Bitcoin ZeroMQ topic names. The {@code toString()} values of these enums are
034     * the values used in the wire-protocol (i.e. they are passed to {@link org.zeromq.ZMQ.Socket#subscribe}.
035     */
036    public enum Topic {
037        hashblock,
038        hashtx,
039        rawblock,
040        rawtx,
041        sequence  // Not implemented in Bitcoin Core as of 0.20.1, but coming in a future release
042    }
043}
